page.title: 16Questionnaire Results
page.content: Children at Brixington Junior School answered with the help of their parents. Most children were born in Exeter, but as Exmouth has no maternity hospital this really means that they think of themselves as Exmouthians. Most parents come from other parts of Britain and have settled in Devon. The commonest type of house lived in is a 3 bedroomed, semi-detached with 2 lavatories and a garage; built in the last 5 years by Wimpey Homes. There are lots of 4 bedroomed detached houses being built near school so our survey would change in a year or two. Out of 190 families 185 have at least 1 car but nearly all children walk to school. Everyone felt there should be more shops in Brixington and many children would like more play-space with equipment or an adventure playground.
